00098 typedef unsigned int uint;
00099 typedef unsigned char byte;

00111 struct LVector4
00112 {
00113     float x;
00114     float y;
00115     float z;
00116     float w;
00117 };
00118 
00119 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00120 
00121 struct LVector3
00122 {
00123     float x;
00124     float y;
00125     float z;
00126     LVector3()
00127     {
00128         x = y = z = 0;
00129     }
00130     LVector3(float x, float y, float z)
00131     {
00132         this->x = x; this->y = y; this->z = z;
00133     }
00134 
00135 };
00136 
00137 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00138 
00139 struct LVector2
00140 {
00141     float x;
00142     float y;
00143 };
00144 
00145 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00146 
00147 struct LColor3
00148 {
00149     float r;
00150     float g;
00151     float b;
00152 };

00156 struct LChunk
00157 {
00158     unsigned short id;
00159     uint start;
00160     uint end;
00161 };

00163 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00164 
00165 struct LTri
00166 {
00167     unsigned short a;
00168     unsigned short b;
00169     unsigned short c;
00170     unsigned long smoothingGroups;
00171     LVector3 normal;
00172     LVector3 tangent;
00173     LVector3 binormal;
00174     uint materialId;
00175     LTri()
00176     {
00177       a = b = c = 0;
00178       smoothingGroups = 0;
00179       materialId = 0;
00180     }
00181 };
00182 
00183 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00184 
00185 struct LTriangle
00186 {
00187     unsigned short a;
00188     unsigned short b;
00189     unsigned short c;
00190 };
00191 
00192 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00193 
00194 struct LMatrix4
00195 {
00196     float _11, _12, _13, _14;
00197     float _21, _22, _23, _24;
00198     float _31, _32, _33, _34;
00199     float _41, _42, _43, _44;
00200 };
00201 
00202 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00203 
00204 struct LTriangle2
00205 {
00206     LVector4 vertices[3];
00207     LVector3 vertexNormals[3];
00208     LVector2 textureCoords[3];
00209     LVector3 faceNormal;
00210     LColor3 color[3];
00211     uint materialId;
00212 };
00213 
00214 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00215 
00216 // a structure for a texture map
00217 struct LMap
00218 {
00219     // the strength of the texture map
00220     float strength;
00221     // the file name of the map. only 8.3 format in 3ds files :(
00222     char mapName[255];
00223     float uScale;
00224     float vScale;
00225     float uOffset;
00226     float vOffset;
00227     float angle;
00228 };

00230 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00231 
00232 class LObject
00233 {
00234   public:
00235     // the default constructor, initializes the m_name here
00236     LObject();
00237 
00238     // the destructor frees memory (m_name)
00239     virtual ~LObject();
00240 
00241     // call this to get the name of the object
00242     virtual const string& GetName();
00243 
00244     // this methods should not be used by the "user", they're used internally to fill the class
00245     // with valid data when reading from file. If you're about to add an importer for another format you'LL
00246     // have to use these methods
00247     // call this to set the name of the object
00248     virtual void SetName(const string& value);
00249 
00250     // returns true if the object's name is the name passed as parameter
00251     bool IsObject(const string &name);
00252 
00253   protected:
00254     // the name of the object
00255     string m_name;
00256 };
00257

00260 class LMaterial : public LObject
00261 {
00262   public:
00263     // the default constructor, does the initialization
00264     LMaterial();
00265 
00266     // the destructor
00267     virtual ~LMaterial();
00268 
00269     // returns the material ID
00270     uint GetID();
00271 
00272     // returns the pointer to the texture map 1
00273     LMap& GetTextureMap1();
00274 
00275     // returns the pointer to the texture map 2
00276     LMap& GetTextureMap2();
00277 
00278     // returns the pointer to the opacity map
00279     LMap& GetOpacityMap();
00280 
00281     // returns the pointer to the specular (gloss) map
00282     LMap& GetSpecularMap();
00283 
00284     // returns the pointer to the bump map
00285     LMap& GetBumpMap();
00286 
00287     // returns the pointer to the reflection map
00288     LMap& GetReflectionMap();
00289 
00290     // returns the ambient color of the material
00291     LColor3 GetAmbientColor();
00292 
00293     // returns the diffuse color of the material
00294     LColor3 GetDiffuseColor();
00295 
00296     // returns the specular color of the material
00297     LColor3 GetSpecularColor();
00298 
00299     // returns the shininess of the material, ranging from 0(matte) to 1(shiny)
00300     float GetShininess();
00301 
00302     // returns the transparency of the material, ranging from 1(fully transparent) to 0(opaque)
00303     float GetTransparency();
00304 
00305     // returns the type of shading, see LShading type
00306     LShading GetShadingType();
00307 
00308     // this methods should not be used by the "user", they're used internally to fill the class
00309     // with valid data when reading from file. If you're about to add an importer for another format you'LL
00310     // have to use these methods
00311     // sets the material ID to "value"
00312     void SetID(uint value);
00313 
00314     // call this to set the ambient color of the material
00315     void SetAmbientColor(const LColor3 &color);
00316 
00317     // sets the diffuse color of the material
00318     void SetDiffuseColor(const LColor3 &color);
00319 
00320     // sets the specular color of the material
00321     void SetSpecularColor(const LColor3 &color);
00322 
00323     // sets the shininess of the material
00324     void SetShininess(float value);
00325 
00326     // sets the transparency of the material
00327     void SetTransparency(float value);
00328 
00329     // sets the shading type
00330     void SetShadingType(LShading shading);
00331 
00332   protected:
00333     // the unique material ID
00334     int m_id;
00335 
00336     // the first texture map
00337     LMap m_texMap1;
00338 
00339     // the second texture map
00340     LMap m_texMap2;
00341 
00342     // the opacity map
00343     LMap m_opacMap;
00344 
00345     // the reflection map
00346     LMap m_reflMap;
00347 
00348     // the bump map
00349     LMap m_bumpMap;
00350 
00351     // specular map
00352     LMap m_specMap;
00353 
00354     // material ambient color
00355     LColor3 m_ambient;
00356 
00357     // material diffuse color
00358     LColor3 m_diffuse;
00359 
00360     // material specular color
00361     LColor3 m_specular;
00362 
00363     // shininess
00364     float m_shininess;
00365 
00366     // transparency
00367     float m_transparency;
00368 
00369     // the shading type for the material
00370     LShading m_shading;
00371 };

00375 class LMesh : public LObject
00376 {
00377   public:
00378     // the default constructor
00379     LMesh();
00380 
00381     // the destructor
00382     virtual ~LMesh();
00383 
00384     // clears the mesh, deleting all data
00385     void Clear();
00386 
00387     // returns the number of vertices in the mesh
00388     uint GetVertexCount();
00389 
00390     // sets the the size of the vertex array - for internal use
00391     void SetVertexArraySize(uint value);
00392 
00393     // returns the number of triangles in the mesh
00394     uint GetTriangleCount();
00395 
00396     // sets the size of the triangle array - for internal use
00397     void SetTriangleArraySize(uint value);
00398 
00399     // returns given vertex
00400     const LVector4& GetVertex(uint index);
00401 
00402     // returns the given normal
00403     const LVector3& GetNormal(uint index);
00404 
00405     // returns the given texture coordinates vector
00406     const LVector2& GetUV(uint index);
00407 
00408     // return the color given the index
00409     LColor3& GetColor(uint index);
00410 
00411     // returns the pointer to the array of tangents
00412     const LVector3& GetTangent(uint index);
00413 
00414     // returns the pointer to the array of binormals
00415     const LVector3& GetBinormal(uint index);
00416 
00417     // sets the vertex at a given index to "vec" - for internal use
00418     void SetVertex(const LVector4 &vec, uint index);
00419 
00420     // sets the normal at a given index to "vec" - for internal use
00421     void SetNormal(const LVector3 &vec, uint index);
00422 
00423     // sets the texture coordinates vector at a given index to "vec" - for internal use
00424     void SetUV(const LVector2 &vec, uint index);
00425 
00426     // sets the color
00427     void SetColor(const LColor3 &vec, uint index);
00428 
00429     // sets the tangent at a given index to "vec" - for internal use
00430     void SetTangent(const LVector3 &vec, uint index);
00431 
00432     // sets the binormal at a given index to "vec" - for internal use
00433     void SetBinormal(const LVector3 &vec, uint index);
00434 
00435     // returns the triangle with a given index
00436     const LTriangle& GetTriangle(uint index);
00437 
00438     // returns the triangle with a given index, see LTriangle2 structure description
00439     LTriangle2 GetTriangle2(uint index);
00440 
00441     // returns the mesh matrix, should be identity matrix after loading
00442     LMatrix4 GetMatrix();
00443 
00444     // sets the mesh matrix to a given matrix - for internal use
00445     void SetMatrix(LMatrix4 m);
00446 
00447     // optimizises the mesh using a given optimization level
00448     void Optimize(LOptimizationLevel value);
00449 
00450     // sets an internal triangle structure with index "index" - for internal use only
00451     void SetTri(const LTri &tri, uint index);
00452 
00453     // returns the pointer to the internal triangle structure - for internal use only
00454     LTri& GetTri(uint index);
00455 
00456     // returns the material id with a given index for the mesh
00457     uint GetMaterial(uint index);
00458 
00459     // adds a material to the mesh and returns its index - for internal use
00460     uint AddMaterial(uint id);
00461 
00462     // returns the number of materials used in the mesh
00463     uint GetMaterialCount();
00464 
00465     // the vertices, normals, etc.
00466     vector<LVector4> m_vertices;
00467     vector<LVector3> m_normals;
00468     vector<LVector3> m_binormals;
00469     vector<LVector3> m_tangents;
00470     vector<LVector2> m_uv;
00471     vector<LColor3> m_colors;
00472 
00473     // triangles
00474     vector<LTriangle> m_triangles;
00475 
00476     //used internally
00477     vector<LTri> m_tris;
00478 
00479     // the transformation matrix.
00480     LMatrix4 m_matrix;
00481 
00482     // the material ID array
00483     vector<uint> m_materials;
00484 
00485     // calculates the normals, either using the smoothing groups information or not
00486     void CalcNormals(bool useSmoothingGroups);
00487 
00488     // calculates the texture(tangent) space for each vertex
00489     void CalcTextureSpace();
00490 
00491     // transforms the vertices by the mesh matrix
00492     void TransformVertices();
00493 };

00497 class LCamera : public LObject
00498 {
00499   public:
00500     // the default constructor
00501     LCamera();
00502 
00503     // the destructor
00504     virtual ~LCamera();
00505

00507     void Clear();
00508 
00509     // sets the position of the camera - for internal use
00510     void SetPosition(LVector3 vec);
00511 
00512     // returns the position of the camera
00513     LVector3 GetPosition();
00514 
00515     // sets the target of the camera - internal use
00516     void SetTarget(LVector3 target);
00517 
00518     // returns the target of the camera
00519     LVector3 GetTarget();
00520 
00521     // sets the fov - internal use
00522     void SetFOV(float value);
00523 
00524     // returns the fov
00525     float GetFOV();
00526 
00527     // sets the bank - internal use
00528     void SetBank(float value);
00529 
00530     // returns the bank
00531     float GetBank();
00532 
00533     // sets the near plane - internal use
00534     void SetNearplane(float value);
00535 
00536     // returns the near plane distance
00537     float GetNearplane();
00538 
00539     // sets the far plane - internal use
00540     void SetFarplane(float value);
00541 
00542     // returns the far plane distance
00543     float GetFarplane();
00544 
00545   protected:
00546     LVector3 m_pos;
00547     LVector3 m_target;
00548         float m_bank;
00549     float m_fov;
00550         float m_near;
00551         float m_far;
00552 };

00572     LVector3 GetPosition();

00575     void SetColor(LColor3 color);
00576 
00577     // returns the color of the light
00578     LColor3 GetColor();
00579 
00580     // sets whether the light is a spotlight or not - internal use
00581     void SetSpotlight(bool value);
00582 
00583     // returns true if the light is a spotlight
00584     bool GetSpotlight();
00585 
00586     // sets the target of the light - internal use
00587     void SetTarget(LVector3 target);
00588 
00589     // returns the target of the spotlight
00590     LVector3 GetTarget();

00592     // sets the hotspot - internal use
00593     void SetHotspot(float value);
00594 
00595     // returns the hotspot
00596     float GetHotspot();
00597 
00598     // sets falloff - internal use
00599     void SetFalloff(float value);
00600 
00601     // returns falloff
00602     float GetFalloff();
00603 
00604     // sets attenuationstart - internal use
00605     void SetAttenuationstart(float value);
00606 
00607     // returns attenuationstart
00608     float GetAttenuationstart();
00609 
00610     // sets attenuationend - internal use
00611     void SetAttenuationend(float value);
00612 
00613     // returns attenuationend
00614     float GetAttenuationend();
00615 
00616   protected:
00617     LVector3 m_pos;
00618     LColor3 m_color;

00628 
00629 class LImporter
00630 {
00631   public:
00632     // the default constructor
00633     LImporter();
00634 
00635     // the destructor
00636     virtual ~LImporter();
00637 
00638     // reads the model from a file, must be overriden by the child classes
00639     virtual bool LoadFile(const char *filename) = 0;
00640 
00641     // returns the number of meshes in the scene
00642     uint GetMeshCount();
00643 
00644     // returns the number of lights in the scene
00645     uint GetLightCount();
00646 
00647     // returns the number of materials in the scene
00648     uint GetMaterialCount();
00649 
00650         // returns the number of cameras in the scene
00651         uint GetCameraCount();
00652 
00653     // returns a pointer to a mesh
00654     LMesh& GetMesh(uint index);
00655 
00656     // returns a pointer to a camera at a given index
00657     LCamera& GetCamera(uint index);
00658 
00659     // returns a pointer to a light at a given index
00660     LLight& GetLight(uint index);
00661 
00662     // returns the pointer to the material
00663     LMaterial& GetMaterial(uint index);
00664 
00665     // returns the pointer to the material with a given name, or NULL if the material was not found
00666     LMaterial* FindMaterial(const string &name);
00667 
00668     // returns the pointer to the mesh with a given name, or NULL if the mesh with such name
00669     // is not present in the scene
00670     LMesh* FindMesh(const string &name);
00671 
00672     // returns the pointer to the camera with a given name, or NULL if not found
00673     LLight* FindCamera(const string &name);
00674 
00675     // returns the pointer to the light with a given name, or NULL if not found
00676     LLight* FindLight(const string &name);
00677 
00678     // sets the optimization level to a given value
00679     void SetOptimizationLevel(LOptimizationLevel value);
00680 
00681     // returns the current optimization level
00682     LOptimizationLevel GetOptimizationLevel();
00683 
00684  protected:
00685     // the cameras found in the scene
00686     vector<LCamera> m_cameras;
00687 
00688     // the lights found in the scene
00689     vector<LLight> m_lights;
00690 
00691     // triangular meshes
00692     vector<LMesh> m_meshes;
00693 
00694     // the materials in the scene
00695     vector<LMaterial> m_materials;
00696 
00697     // level of optimization to perform on the meshes
00698     LOptimizationLevel m_optLevel;
00699 
00700     // clears all data.
00701     virtual void Clear();
00702 };
00703 
00704 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
00705 
00706 class L3DS : public LImporter
00707 {
00708   public:
00709     // the default constructor
00710     L3DS();
00711 
00712     // constructs the object and loads the file
00713     L3DS(const char *filename);
00714 
00715     // destructor
00716     virtual ~L3DS();
00717 
00718     // load 3ds file
00719     virtual bool LoadFile(const char *filename);
00720 
00721   protected:
00722     // used internally for reading
00723     char m_objName[100];
00724 
00725     // true if end of file is reached
00726     bool m_eof;
00727 
00728     // buffer for loading, used for speedup
00729     unsigned char *m_buffer;
00730 
00731     // the size of the buffer
00732     uint m_bufferSize;
00733 
00734     // the current cursor position in the buffer
00735     uint m_pos;
00736 
00737     // reads a short value from the buffer
00738     short ReadShort();
00739 
00740     // reads an int value from the buffer
00741     int ReadInt();
00742 
00743     // reads a char from the buffer
00744     char ReadChar();
00745 
00746     // reads a float value from the buffer
00747     float ReadFloat();
00748 
00749     // reads an unsigned byte from the buffer
00750     byte ReadByte();
00751 
00752     // reads an asciiz string
00753     int ReadASCIIZ(char *buf, int max_count);
00754 
00755     // seek within the buffer
00756     void Seek(int offset, int origin);
00757 
00758     // returns the position of the cursor
00759     uint Pos();
00760 
00761     // read the chunk and return it.
00762     LChunk ReadChunk();
00763 
00764     // read until given chunk is found
00765     bool FindChunk(LChunk &target, const LChunk &parent);
00766 
00767     // skip to the end of chunk "chunk"
00768     void SkipChunk(const LChunk &chunk);
00769 
00770     // goes to the beginning of the data in the given chunk
00771     void GotoChunk(const LChunk &chunk);
00772 
00773     // the function read the color chunk (any of the color chunks)
00774     LColor3 ReadColor(const LChunk &chunk);
00775 
00776     // the function that read the percentage chunk and returns a float from 0 to 1
00777     float ReadPercentage(const LChunk &chunk);
00778 
00779     // this is where 3ds file is being read
00780     bool Read3DS();
00781 
00782     // read a light chunk
00783     void ReadLight(const LChunk &parent);
00784 
00785         // read a camera chunk
00786         void ReadCamera(const LChunk &parent);
00787 
00788     // read a trimesh chunk
00789     void ReadMesh(const LChunk &parent);
00790 
00791     // reads the face list, face materials, smoothing groups... and fill the information into the mesh
00792     void ReadFaceList(const LChunk &chunk, LMesh &mesh);
00793 
00794     // reads the material
00795     void ReadMaterial(const LChunk &parent);
00796 
00797     // reads the map info and fills the given map with this information
00798     void ReadMap(const LChunk &chunk, LMap& map);
00799 
00800     // reads keyframer data of the OBJECT_NODE_TAG chunk
00801     void ReadKeyframeData(const LChunk &parent);
00802 
00803     // reads the keyheader structure from the current offset and returns the frame number
00804     long ReadKeyheader();
00805 };
